title: The Epic Week of Ling Campbell: From Sculptor to Hero
summary: Ling Campbell, a 74-year-old retired sculptor and teacher, discovers her ability to control clay and stone, which she uses to thwart a robbery and inspire her town.
summaryGerman: Ling Campbell, eine 74-jährige pensionierte Bildhauerin und Lehrerin, entdeckt ihre Fähigkeit, Ton und Stein zu kontrollieren, die sie verwendet, um einen Raub zu vereiteln und ihre Stadt zu inspirieren.
summaryDutch: Ling Campbell, een 74-jarige gepensioneerde beeldhouwster en lerares, ontdekt haar vermogen om klei en steen te beheersen, wat ze gebruikt om een overval te verijdelen en haar stad te inspireren.
summaryFrench: Ling Campbell, une sculptrice et enseignante retraitée de 74 ans, découvre sa capacité à contrôler l'argile et la pierre, qu'elle utilise pour déjouer un vol et inspirer sa ville.

story.text: On a peaceful morning, Ling Campbell discovers she can manipulate clay with her mind while sculpting in her workshop.
Feeling energetic, Ling uses her newfound powers to create intricate and lifelike sculptures, amazing her students.
Ling feels a sense of purpose, deciding to secretly use her powers to repair broken public sculptures around town at night.
News spreads of the miraculous repairs. The town buzzes with theories, giving Ling a quiet satisfaction as she teaches her class.
An attempted robbery at a local museum sees Ling turning the getaway car into stone, stopping the thieves in their tracks, under an eerie moonlit sky.
Ling becomes a local legend as tales of a mysterious 'Stone Guardian' go viral. She feels a mix of pride and concern for her privacy.
In an epic display, Ling unveils a new public sculpture at the park, dedicated to the town, symbolizing unity and resilience.

ending: As Ling Campbell looked over her town from her studio, she smiled, knowing she had not only changed the landscape but also the hearts of its people.
moral: You are never too old to discover new gifts or change the community for the better.
